bill_title: to allow privately owned real property to be specifically classified for the purpose of taxation if the property is open for public hunting through an agreement with the State of South Dakota.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow privately owned real property to be specifically classified for the purpose of taxation if the property is open for public hunting through an agreement with the State of South Dakota. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 10-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the owner of any real property enters into an agreement with the State of South Dakota to permit public hunting and the owner does not accept any lease payments from the state, the property is hereby specifically classified for the purpose of taxation. The classification of property pursuant to this section is in lieu of any state lease payments. Property taxes shall be levied on the valuation of such property where the level of assessment represents seventy percent of the market value as determined by the Department of Revenue. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
